HaDeX is an R package for analysis of HDX-MS data. Although all functionalities are available in the form of a web server and a standalone tool, some of the vignettes are more directed towards the command-line usage of HaDeX.

# General resources

1. [Basics of HDX-MS](hdxms.Rmd): Fundamental principles of the analysis of HDX-MS data.
2. [Glossary](glossary.html): all definitions and equations necessary to understand the theoretical basics of HaDeX.
3. [Data visualization](visualisation.html): visualisations of HDX-MS data implemented in HaDeX.
4. [Data usage](datafiles.html): an in-depth description how HaDeX interprets input data from DynamX 3.0 and 2.0.

# Resources for the command-line usage

1. [Code usage](usage.html): an example of the usage of HaDeX functions.
2. [Experimental examples](examples.html): a full analytic workflow of HaDeX performed in the R console.
